IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK ASSOCIATION IS THE FRIENDS GROUP FOR CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK AND ENGAGES PUBLIC SUPPORT AND PROVIDES SERVICES TO ENHANCE PUBLIC USE AND ENJOYMENT OF THE PARK.
IRS990.MissionDescription: CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK ASSOCIATION IS THE FRIENDS GROUP FOR CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK AND ENGAGES PUBLIC SUPPORT AND PROVIDES SERVICES TO ENHANCE PUBLIC USE AND ENJOYMENT OF THE PARK. IT MANAGES CUYAHOGA VALLEY ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTER, WHICH SERVES OVER 10,000 CHILDREN EACH YEAR IN RESIDENT AND DAY PROGRAMS, RAISES FUNDS FOR PARK PROJECTS AND OFFERS ACTIVITIES WHICH BRING PEOPLE TO THE PARK.CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK ASSOCIATION OFFERS A VARIETY OF WAYS FOR PEOPLE TO ENGAGE WITH CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS, VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES, MEMBERSHIP, FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR PARK PROJECTS, USE OF PARK SPACES FOR MEETINGS AND EVENTS AND PARK STORES.
IRS990.Description: ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION - Cuyahoga Valley Environmental Education Center is a 128 bed residential learning center that serves area schools with a four day, three night educational program that meets state standards. The school curriculum features field based experiences that complement what students learn in the classroom. Summer camps are offered on a variety of themes, including science and the arts, and the center also offers one day field trips for schools, summer day camps and family programs. A hallmark of the center is that 25% of the children served receive scholarships because of their identified poverty level, meaning that many urban and low income children are served. For many children, this is their first experience in a national park and for some it is their only camp experience. Another important aspect of the program is the leadership experience that is offered to young adults through a 10 month graduate level internship in environmental education. Hundreds of young adults have participated in this program and now carry the message of the importance of national parks and of the environment in careers in teaching, administration, business, etc.

Activity2.Description: COMMUNITY OUTREACH - Cuyahoga Valley National Park Association reaches out to the community and provides for public engagement with the national park in a variety of ways. Several thousand people participate each year in a variety of volunteer opportunities. CVNPA provides management and oversight of the volunteer program. CVNPA also manages meeting and event spaces for the park, which allows thousands of people each year to participate in meetings, conferences, special events, such as weddings and reunions, in the context of a national park. For many people, this is their first exposure to the park and people value the unique venues that the park provides, in addition to the interpretation about the park and its resources for participants. CVNPA also offers two retail outlets that serve as welcome centers for the park. People can purchase refreshments, park logoed clothing, convenience items and educational materials related to park themes. Special activities and programs are offered in the two sites, and many are geared to families and to younger children. CVNPA also reaches out to the community on behalf of the park at various events and activities throughout the year.

Activity3.Description: PARK SUPPORT - Several key programs are sponsored each year. These programs are designed to make people aware of what the park has to offer and enhance the public's use of the park.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Association has adopted guidance, as required by the Income Taxes Topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification regarding accounting for uncertainty in income taxes. This guidance clarifies the accounting and recognition for income tax positions taken or expected to be taken in the Association's income tax returns. As of August 31, 2010, the Association has no uncertain tax positions that qualify for either recognition or disclosure in the financial statements. The Association records related interest expenses and penalties, if any, as a tax expense, consistent with this guidance. The Association's open audit periods are for the tax years ended August 31, 2007 through August 31, 2010. In evaluating the Association's tax provisions and accruals, future taxable income, the reversal of temporary differences, interpretations, and tax planning strategies are considered. The Association believes their estimates are appropriate based on the current facts and circumstances.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XI, Line 8: Other Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances
Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Endowment Funds entitled Trails Forever Legacy Funds are maintained at each of the Akron Community Foundation and the Cleveland Foundation. Annual earnings proceeds from these funds come through CVNPA, and are 100% distributed to the Cuyahoga Valley National Park for the purpose of maintaining and operating the trail systems of the national park.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: SCHOLARSHIPS TO PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENTS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EDU

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE BY REQUEST. THE 990 IS AVAILABLE ON THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE AS WELL AS BY REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The compensation of executive officers and staff is analyzed based on surveys completed by the Friends Alliance and the Association of Partners in Public Lands. The compensation of executive officers and staff is then compared with those of the employees of Cuyahoga Valley National Park. The salaries are also compared with those in the Midwest, according to the Chronicle of Philanthropy and then is compared with salaries of other various non-profit organizations in the area. Reviews are conducted throughout the year to ensure that performance merits the appropriate salary.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: An extensive conflict of interest policy is presented to the board members and all employees annually. The board members and employees are to read over the policy, disclose any possible conflicts, and provide a signature that he/she understands the policy and has disclosed the necessary information.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The form 990 is reviewed by CVNPA's Finance Committee, the CEO, the CDO and the COO. The Finance Committee has been appointed by the Board to approve the 990 after a thorough review. The approved 990 was sent via email to all of the Board members.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: VOLUNTEER CENTER - CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK ASSOCIATION RAISED FUNDS FROM VARIOUS DONORS AND CONTRIBUTED THOSE FUNDS TO THE CUYAHOGA VALLEY NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING, DESIGN, CONSTRUCTION, AND HISTORIC RESTORATION OF FOUR VOLUNTEER CENTER COMPLEX BUILDINGS.
